paper.title: A shared object hierarchy

author.org: Computer Science Division, EECS Department, University of California Berkeley, CA#TAB#

paper.venue: OODS '86 Proceedings on the 1986 international workshop on Object-oriented database systems
paper.abstract: This paper describes the design and proposed implementation of a shared object hierarchy. The object hierarchy is stored in a relational database and objects referenced by an application program are cached in the programu0027s address space. The paper describes the database representation for the object hierarchy and the use of POSTGRES, a next-generation relational database management system, to implement object referencing efficiently. The shared object hierarchy system will be used to implement Object FADS, an object-oriented programming environment for interactive database applications that will be the main programming interface to POSTGRES.
